FuncDef:
The cache source-address command is used to configure the source IPv6 address of encapsulated packets from SF to SFF.
The undo cache source-address command is used to remove the encapsulation configuration of the source IPv6 address.
By default, the source IPv6 address of encapsulated packets is not configured from SF to SFF.

ParaDef.Info:
Source IPv6 address.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is used to configure the source IPv6 address for encapsulating packets from SF to SFF.
Precautions
There may be multiple SFCs. Currently, only one of them can be configured.
